text: Enjoyed the Tortellini and the service was excellent. Bypass the wanna be places like the Tilted Kilt in this area and go to a real place for food.

Just got a kale and steak salad to go for lunch.  Walked back to my office, opened it up and noticed it didn't have half of what was supposed to be in it (kale, quinoa, caramelized onions).  Took a couple bites of it as/is and it was terrible - lettuce wilted and steak raw on the inside.  Called the restaurant to let them know and of course they said if I came back they'd make me a new one.  It's 95 degrees outside and I don't care to make the 10 minute walk again.  No refund offered.  What a waste of money.  Will not go back.
I really enjoyed dinner here. Loved the ambience, which reminded me of being in NYC. The service was excellent as was the food. Highly recommend.
The food is horrible! We had chicken Parmesan which tasted like old salty tomatoes and creamy vegetable pasta which tasted like glue! Stay away! Very disappointed and waste of money.
Sit in the back by the storage closet..... And get the Mac n Cheese........ The End........ And get a Sangria..... The real end...... Now will this post or is it still too short for posting

I'd like to something favorable about this place. The restaurant next door had an hour wait so we decided to try the Strand. BIG MISTAKE!!! We were quickly seated but were promptly IGNORED for the next 30 minutes. I knew it wasn't just us as others were commenting on the terrible service. Thankfully, we still had time to visit the Tilted Kilt just down the street before our show. Thanks for nothing Strand. That's no way to treat your customers!!
Service was great but the food wasn't noteworthy.  We ordered lasagna & chicken alla vodka with salads.  The lasagna was cold and the vodka sauce was bland.
Came to town for the College Football National Championship. Excellent service, pasta, drinks and scenery. 100% recommended. Don't listen to these other negative reviews. Roll Tide

Food was horrible! Service wasn't much better......we just moved into city scape and we are trying new places, and now this is off our list. 

Clams and mussels were very salty!!! Tried the lobster Mac n cheese and it was dry. 

Definitely won't be back!!!
Hidden little gem. Great staff and good! Highly recommend the shrimp and broccoli alfredo!

I have visited this restaurant once before for lunch. I had a salad. Nothing to write home about. So when I had a dinner meeting scheduled last night at Strand, I had no expectations. The food was non significant but not horrible. The salmon I order well came to the table medium rare. I ate two bites at the ends. The rest was inEdible. After paying our bill, my group of four noticed a cockroach as big as my thumb crawling against the wall. It made my skin crawl! I showed the slow crawling cockroach to the waitress. She didn't flinch. She signaled she saw the roach with a nod of her head the shouted out to someone by the kitchen as to signal "another roach sighting". 

I will not be back every again. This morning my stomach is turning and I have been in the bathroom on and off. Not sure if it was the Angry Shrimp (which was too spicy to enjoy) or an indication of a nasty kitchen. Eat at your own risk.

I took my brother and his GF for dinner. 
Food: 
Calamari appetizer: good amount to split between three, nice crunch and tasted fresh.
Creamy Alfredo w/chicken: my brother ordered it, I tried it. Very creamy. He finished it all.
Salmon and Grilled Vegetable: I ordered this, the salmon was so flavorful and juicy. Really enjoyable meal. I don't usually like salads, but this hit the spot after all the holiday carbs.
Pomodoro: the GF got this. I didn't try it, but she said it was good.

Drinks: 
Cabernet Sauvigon - I love wine, I ordered it to expand my brother's palette... we switched drinks and he really liked the cucumber martini.
2 Cucumber Crush Martinis: I tried it, soo yummy. It was strong, but still had flavor. Hit all around!

Ambiance: loved the decorated walls and interesting lighting fixtures. We were the only ones there for a while until a family came in. It's a hidden gem.

$100 for three people!!? Yes, definitely worth a try, I will have to take others there when I go back in town.
Stopped in for lunch the other day because it was close by, and WOW what a wonderful surprise! The food is delicious, great service too. I will be coming in again with my husband to taste more!

Fantastic Find! We both had great salads for lunch - Calamari salad for one, Pear & Goat Cheese salad for the other - and they were superb. Bread and dipping oil were also good. Service was excellent, although slow (but it WAS during Lunch Rush). Sophisticated atmosphere without  being "urban pretentious." Tables are close enough together that you'd better watch what you say if you don't want to be overheard. Check out their weekday Breakfast offerings, too - they look good. We highly recommend, and plan to go again soon.
Been wanting to try this place for awhile. Service was great, good reasonable prices. Food was good and had a nice selection of beers to choose from. Will definitely be going here again.

Went to The Strand last night and was disappointed enough to write a review. It was our second visit in the past six months and it will certainly be our last.
For starters, the temperature inside was too cool even though the outdoor temperature was only in the upper 40's. My meal was cold halfway into it and I am a pretty fast eater (my wife reminds me).  The bread came out and the appetizer plates were still wet. We opened our napkin rolls and the napkins were still damp as if they had been taken out of the dryer far too early. My leg became chilled from the damp cloth laying on it partially due to the chilly temperature of the restaurant and partially due to the damp cloth napkin.
My wife was chilly enough to order a coffee prior to dinner. Upon telling the server that she was cold and needed a cup of coffee the response was only that they did not have coffee, only espresso. My wife ordered a tea that became cold fairly quickly and as I glanced up at the large drink menu behind the bar I saw that they had Cafe Americano listed. That would have been a good suggestion for a coffee substitute had our server been on her game.
The appetizer, Risotto Arancini, was so-so. My wife's Meatballs and "Strands" was served warm but she felt as though the meatballs were previously frozen and not homemade. Nothing to write home about. My entree, Chicken Piccata, was lacking in the flavor department and as I previously mentioned was cold half way through trying to enjoy it.
Apart from the restaurant being too cold there was nothing terrible about the experience it's just that is was a mediocre meal with less that professional service. The server that waited on the table next to us squatted down and rested his arms on one of the table's chairs to take their order. Unfortunately we see this a lot in our current society but I want a professional, well informed yet non-intrusive server that adds to the quality of the dinning experience. Not another dinner buddy.
This was not "A Unique Dining Experience" that they self proclaim. Just over priced for the sub-par dining experience.

The chicken alla Vodka was very taste, the minestrone soup was quite nice. The fried zucchini appetizer was light and crispy. Finished off with the bread pudding which was just right amount of crispy with soft inside.

Terrible service. Went to eat here Saturday night before a movie. After waiting in line for 20 minutes they said they could no longer take food orders and asked us to leave. I have never heard of a restaurant dealing with customers like this. I was excited to have an Italian fast casual restaurant in my neighborhood but I do not think I will be eating here again. Food is ok, but I would suggest not eating here when it is a busy night. Clearly the management is not up for the job.

Host practically sleeping at the stand. It took him a minute to process our request "table for 2." There are several large groups here which has stolen our server's time and attention. Food was fine. Sweet potato fries awesome. Seafood Linguini was not too impressive....snooze

My husband and I went to dinner here on a friend's recommendation. We were so glad we did! The prices were reasonable and the food and service were amazing! All of the staff was very friendly, stopping by to chat with us and see how we were doing, and the manager seemed genuinely interested in our happiness. The lights are fun, too - they look like impressionistic pasta. :-) If you like seafood, pasta or cheese, then you will be quite pleased. We are planning to return in the very near future.

They are on board with social media (Twitter and Facebook so far) but I don't see them on Pinterest yet (wouldn't I love some of those recipes!) though they are part of CityScape: http://pinterest.com/cityscapephx/

Twitter: @StrandItalian 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TheStrandItalian

Feel bad for hard working bartender Sarah.  She works hard while the kitchen boys clown.  Ordered a pizza, that showed up undercooked and gross.  Sent most back and said - I'll take the check 
Will not return even under duress

The pasta is pretty good. I like their hamburger with the fries the most. My co-worker loves this place. Service can be a little slow so you will need to have patience but I think it is a good place to eat

The food was great but the service was a little slow.  We got there at 5:30 thinking it was early enough.  We got seated right away and our drinks came fast but then there was a rush of new people coming in and it took awhile to see our waiter again to take our order.  I think since there was a Suns game that night they just didnt have enough staff.

My BIL, my son (who's a toddler) and I ate here. We stopped a couple of places down first, but apparently that place doesn't like kids because they had neither booster seats or high chairs. So The Strand it was. We both had the chicken with vodka sauce, which we both really liked. He also had the house Merlot which he thought was really good. The service was fairly attentive, forgot just one item. But I ordered from the Kid's menu, wanting spaghetti for my little guy, and the menu listed penne. I knew that was a no go. So she said she could sub in another pasta. Was is spaghetti? No, but very close. Are the noodles thicker? Yes, but it's just like spaghetti, promise.  I said I was unsure, she assured me it was similar enough. My son isn't old enough to have figured out the conversation himself, but he was sure that wasn't spaghetti when it hit the table. Wouldn't touch it. Fortunately I had brought  a couple of things with me so I fed him those instead, but we didn't need to waste money on his kid's meal.
Really great little place!  Cool vibe, excellent food.

Service is usually pretty slow so make sure you have time to spend! Food is pretty good but if you go on a night where there is an event in DTPHX with lots of people the prices are jacked up about $5 per plate! The Pasta Primavera is really good and you have to try the Lobster Mac!

The reason for only two stars is not because of the food. I ordered the Quinoa dinner and it tasted great with fresh vegetables cooked perfectly. We had bruschetta which was served very interesting, you had to make it yourself so to speak it was served with the bread on the side of a bowl of Tomatoes.  We had two waitress's who seemed to both disappear when it came time to eat... We asked for bread with our dinner and it came after we had finished. She mentioned it needed to be cut was why it took so long. No apologies. Also when we didn't have silverware it was because it needed to be rolled. It was odd service to say the least. The waitress kept putting her hair up and down playing with it, I found that in poor taste. I would have enjoyed it more if the service was better.
I love this place :) The bruschetta is my favorite appetizer ....  I also love the Quinoa!  Every time I've gone, the service has always been excellent!

The food arrived quick. It took them no time at all to pull the bolognese sauce out of the can.  The only thing good about the restaurant is the location. But it does not make up for the meals. Not going back.

Service and attention is definitely slow. The sound system is annoying with a loud, thumping bass. Not something I want while eating. I've been waiting twenty minutes and am sitting with bread and water.  Just received my side, dinner salad. Very large for the $3 price. Also very bland. I asked for more salad dressing and almost finished m my salad before it came. I hope the entree exceeds the experience so far.  Redemption... sort of. A very large chicken parmigiana. Adequate flavor. Certainly does not lure me to take another bite.  They should put a little more attention to flavor and service and not impress people just with portion size.

Great little spot I've passed it so many time and never realized it was there. Amazing Italian did, I've had the lobster mac and cheese with drunken breadsticks, left me so full and definitely happy. Then I also had the Salsiccia Di Pollo, so good! I would definitely recommend this place for really good Italian food that is reasonably priced.

I'm in town working for a SuperBowl related function, several days before the game.   I went to this restaurant because the menu on their website looked tasty and affordable.   I was greeted with a menu that had prices more than DOUBLE those that were on their website.   The pasta dish I ordered might have been passable at the original menu price.  It was a major rip-off at the inflated price I paid.   The dish was bland, with overcooked generic boxed pasta.   I had to use a bunch of salt and nearly the whole shaker of Parmesan cheese to give it some taste.  

The only saving grace was the fast service and friendly waitress.  

The restaurant was empty, so this was not a case of immediate supply and demand.  This was price-gouging plain and simple.

Stopped in for a drink only so I can't comment on the food, except that the menu & the food coming out of the kitchen looked and smelled so good that we'll go for lunch or dinner next time. The cucumber crush martini was outstanding & the service was good.

Sports crowd, loud overhead music, crowded seating, and most of the food was generic, as if delivered as prepackaged right off the truck. Generic hotel restaurant type food - didn't seem like the menu was prepared specially for the restaurant by a chef. Caesar salad was bland. Lasagna was nothing special. Seafood on the seafood linguini was small and not fresh. Everything seemed pre-made. We left thinking we could have had a better meal at home, and we paid over $80 for two people. I was surprised by the high ratings. We will not go back. There are better restaurants in Phoenix.
This is a great place. Came to the area for a conference and was looking for something local. Would definitely go back. Pesto dipping sauce for bread is amazing.

This restaurant is EXCELLENT!  The decor is very modern and so cool.  The staff is very polite and friendly.  The food is brilliant!  My husband and I both got the spaghetti and meatballs.  It is probably the best I've ever had. The sauce is creamy and perfectly seasoned.  The meatballs have a tang and burst with flavor.  I highly recommend!
Good inexpensive lunch stop.  Great food.  Never had a problem getting seated during the lunch rush.  We go pretty regularly and will continue to.

The Strand was a good place to eat in Phoenix, but nothing that really stood out to me. It was not a true authentic Italian restaurant. It satisfied my group and I for dinner. I had the salmon with pasta, the salmon was great served over steamed spinach. The past was average needed more flavor. My fiend had the pasta mac and cheese, it was missing a crispiness on top. Overall, good place for the atmosphere, good service food was average.
The food was excellent, the Martinis were to die for and the service was excellent. Plus Happy Hour prices made it a perfect choice

Decent lunch place after fan fest at chase. 

Seated promptly after most things on down town were closed after 2 pm on a Sunday. Decided on a fig and proscuto piZza. While I had wished the prosciutto was fried and crispy on top, it didn't disappoint. I intended on eating half and proceeded to eating the whole pie.

Girlfriend had a balsamic salad with chicken. While the greens were crisp and well seasoned croutons were the best I have had, the chicken breast was cooked into submission and came out with a mealy dry texture. 

Dani was our waitress; she was prompt and not overly chatty or interrupting ever 3rd sentence while we were enjoying our conversation. Not sure what customer service issues other yelp people have had, but ours was very pleasing.

All but one of our entrees was cold, and one of our appetizers was also cold. Server was slow in coming and taking our orders. It was busy, but she could have at least acknowledge our existence. Service could be lots better, especially considering the prices. Most likely won't be back.

My boyfriend and I adore the Strand, and wanted to give our server a shout out from last night. Kristen was incredibly helpful and sweet after an error on our part and a kitchen error. We'd also like to thank the manager, I believe his name was Ross. You guys were outstanding, thank you so much.

Excellent

Service is great and the food is very tasty. 
All of their items taste home made.  Nothing tastes pre packaged.  

They validate parking, too! And they have a decent amount of gluten free options.

The Strand has great food and fantastic service. I went there with a couple of my friends for birthday lunch, and our waitress was incredibly nice and outgoing. We ordered a variety of food, all of which was delicious. Highly recommend

WARNING... TYPING THIS REVIEW WHILE CONSUMING THE BEST PIZZA EVER!!

I couldn't wait to write a review about the newest downtown restaurant - I am still eating. The Strand is a welcome addition to the downtown lunch and dinner spots. Their staff, menu, service, pricing, and ambiance is great. Ordered a garlic pizza (best combination of flavors and toppings I have EVER had on a pizza) with pesto on the side to dip. I am a pesto-connoisseur, and theirs is tops!

Not a long wait for my pizza (less than 10 minutes), but you can call your order in ahead, too.

I can't wait for lunch tomorrow to try something else! And for happy hour after work to try the delish-sounding frozen peach Bellini!

YAY STRAND!!

Great lil gem. Make sure to ask for Ashley! Knows the menu, friendly personality wo being over bearing! We had shrimp and bread apps. Great sauces on both!  Only minimal downside is that we'd have liked more sauce with the mussels. Great experience.

Nice atmosphere. Generous portions. Salad was excellent. Pasta (it was the daily special, so I don't know a name) was cooked well; sauce was tasty but nothing spectacular. House-prepared bread pudding was very good. Modest wine list, but adequate variety.

My service was lousy, but everyone has a bad night. Yours would probably (and easily) be better.

Price and convenient location were other criteria for me. All things considered, I got what I bargained for.

We should have ran the other way when we walked in and only saw 1 table filled... On a Friday night. After eating here, I understand why only 1 table was filled. Food was nothing special at all. Regretful, in fact. I don't see this place lasting more then another month if each Friday only has 1-2 tables filled.
The calamari we ordered was cold and the food was just very bland. I don't suggest coming here.

This is a TOP Restaurant on FoodTube.net, The Video Guide to TOP Restaurants.  Check out their video:

http://foodtube.net/video/italian-the-strand-phoenix-az

We came here only because we were downtown and needed to eat in a hurry. The fact that every other restaurant on the block had at least a 45-minute wait was a red flag, but I thought, how bad can Italian food be? As it turns out, terrible. Everything tastes like it came from a school cafeteria.

Enjoyed a great meal with outstanding service in a very nice setting in downtown Phoenix,  food was delicious and the staff very friendly and the service was very good.  Definitely make this a destination if your in downtown Phoenix.

Went here for our anniversary dinner. We got there late night so it wasn't crowded at all. Here's the breakdown:

Pros:
*Food was decent
*Nice vibe
*TVs inside and there was a soccer game going
*Waiter was nice

 Cons:
*Took way too long for hostess to seat us
*Food was tasty but my husband's suspicions were raised because it came out very quickly

I would go back again, for drinks and a late meal because it was a cozy spot.

This place was terrible. Lobster Mac and Cheese was the worst I've ever had. They just took penne lobster and cheese and through it together. Very unimaginative. Service was dreadful too.  Waitress took our drink and appetizer order then disappeared for 40 minutes, and I'm not exaggerating.  I won't be returning. There are no less than one hundred Italian Restaurants in the Valley that are better than this place.  I should have known when the Titled kilt and Arrogant Butcher each had over an hour wait to be seated and the Strand had an empty restaurant that there was a reason for that.

My family and I came in worn out and unhappy with what had just happened. Having to leave another good rated place. We were seated right away and ordered quickly, our food came out fast and delicious. The lobster mac and cheese was absolutely my favorite dish there! Overall I would come back again without a doubt.
Favorite Italian place in Phoenix. I've ordered multiple dishes and they were all amazing. They rotate in new dishes regularly so there's always something new to try. Very friendly upbeat staff!
Very salty food obscenely slo service cheese cake was stale 2 appetizers and desert took 2 hours

Just had lunch at the Strand today.  We shared a chicken Parmesan pizza, and a pressed, fresh veggie sandwich.  We also had Cesar salad and minestrone soup.  Every thing was home made ad tasted great.   The staff was friendly, helpful and attentive to our needs.  Very unique / eclectic, comfortable decor.  Nice size portions and a very reasonable price.  

This is my new go to restaurant when I have meetings downtown.

We were just walking by trying to decide where to eat. We saw the sign that said lasagna special.  We LOVE lasagna!  Decided to give 'em a try. Imagine our disappointment when we try to order and they say that they are out of lasagna. .. Wait, what?  An Italian restaurant out of lasagna? ? AND they weren't open very long. LOL!  Still, the roast beef was good and the pasta pomadoro was delicious.  I would recommend them,  so check them out next time you down town.

Went on Monday night. Food was delcious. I wanted the small plate butternut squash, almost like a primavera with protien. They delivered an incredible meal. My brother for Spaghetti and Meatballs ( called something else) his was delicious (he's picky). GREAT prices too

Jeremiah is great! He is very friendly, patient, and knows what he's doing! 

We started off with the Drunken Cheesy Bread, it's ok. Not something I would want again. Nothing wrong with it, just not my taste. 

For lunch, I had the Chicken Parmesan sandwich, along with a house salad. The sandwich is great. Loved it. 
The house salad... I mean, I could not stop eating it. I have no idea which kind of dressing was on it, but it was AMAZING. I am craving it just thinking about it. 

The interior is very clean, roomy, very casual. I heard they have great happy hour, so I will be back again.

WORST SERVICE ever and mediocre food....came here for a quick bite before the Suns game. The atmosphere is really nice and it looks fancy and expensive but it's actually reasonably priced. We sat down right away and waited 10 min just to put our drink orders in. We got our drinks within 5 minutes and ordered Calamari and a side salad...that's it! The calamari came out so fast literally within 7 minutes and it was absolutely disgusting. There was no flavor at all! We're waiting 25 minutes and my salad still hasn't arrived! Literally a side salad, oh and let's not forget my waiter was no where to be found. I saw the hostess walking around and I told them to cancel the salad and take the calamari off cuz it's disgusting and we're not eating it or paying for it. 
Our "waiter" was also the bartender and never came back to check on us. I'm also pretty sure that bread is complimentary and we NEVER got any. 
I also noticed that people around were looking for a server to place their order and based on reviews here the service ALWAYS sucks. 
I definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND.

This restaurant is the best in Phoenix!! I had a Marguerite pizza and it was absolutely delicious! I also had a Cesar salad that was so fresh! My dad had a salmon plate and he could not stop talking about how good it was! I was surprised about how good it was for being a corner restaurant!

Came here for dinner on Saturday night with a few friends. Our waiter, James, was terrible. He was rude unhelpful. He rarely came to check and see if we needed anything, and if we did ask him for anything, we would never receive it. I asked for a glass of water 3 times, and still never received it. Our table was never given bread, until we asked another server to grab it for us. I would not suggest this restaurant, unless average food and bad service is your forte.

Close to our hotel and surrounded by other restaurants and bars....the patio advertised a special.... the "drunken shrimp" had me and hello. Not always a fan of Italian, but I was excited to see what the Strand had to offer. We were exhausted from the Spring training games and the weather was perfect outside for mid March. So, we sat outside..........the restaurant was bustling busy, but we were seated right away and offered drink specials, menu etc. Sitting outside always has its plus side beside the breeze on a perfect night, but the walking traffic was entertaining to say the least. If you are offended by the homeless, I suggest do not sit out side - but we felt comfortable and enjoyed our views of the city lights and busy Rickshaw's none the less. The service was delightful, we received the complimentary bread and olive oil/balsamic for dipping and ordered a great bottle of wine. Our food came quickly and the drunken shrimp special was AMAZING! My partner in crime ordered the Chicken Parmesan and easily filled his tummy with room to spare for Tiramisu which was so silky smooth and delicious. There were couples and families with children - so I would say family atmosphere.Large portions for the price and we were truly happy with our dining choice for the evening. Until next March Strand, see you soon.

OMG if I could give this place ZERO stars it would so deserve it!! My partner and I went for dinner and drinks and it was the worst place ever!! It was so over priced for the crappy weak drinks and horrible tasting food!! C'mon you'd have to be a total idiot to ruin something as simple as chicken Alfredo!! It had absolutely no flavor I had to ask the server to bring me some spices to season it up. To finish up, we never got out appetizer and they were still going to charge me for it had I not thrown a fit about it!! Stay away from this over priced, nasty tasting food establishment!!

Been here 4 times. Only got in 2 times
 Posted hours mean nothing. They close when business is slow. First meal they forgot to bring the bread with my meal. Had to ask for it. It came cold. Second time I got there 2 hours befor posted closing time. Bone fragment in my meat sauce. Could not order anything else because they shut down the registers after I had placed my order. Grrrrrrrrrrrrrr
The food here is amazing. The staff is super friendly.   The restaurant is also very clean!  I would recommend coming here when in the downtown Phoenix area!

I came here with my sister and we had a great time. We had a charming server who we thought was probably new and therefore a tad nervous. Cute. 

We shares a large Parmesan French fries and it was way too much for just two people, but they were good. My sister had the Alfredo pasta and it was delicious. I wish I would have ordered that for myself!  I had pasta with a vodka sauce that was good, but couldn't compete with the Alfredo! 

The lights at this place are cool too.

Went here Thursday for a business lunch. Ordered prosciutto & fig pizza with two side salads. The food was good. The service was frustrating. It took 30 minutes to get the salads. After finishing our salads we asked when the pizza would be out. The waitress had put our pizza "on hold" until we finished our salads. Who does this?? The entire meal took 1.5 hours. No one has this much time for lunch. I won't be back.

We love this place.  This time around I had the crab linguine in a spicy lobster sauce (minus the asparagus) and my boyfriend had the pasta alfredo with chicken.  As with our previous dinners here, the food was excellent as was the service.  Bridget was helpful and pleasant.

I'm surprised at the negative reviews. Granted, I have only been to The Strand once, but I received great service and great food. Their happy hour specials are amazing. I got the best burger I've ever had in Arizona, along with delicious parmesean garlic fries and a beer, all for $10 plus tip. Truly a great deal, especially for happy hour.

Came in right before the Carrie Underwood concert and albeit was busy the waitress was slow in getting to us to take our order. Ordered the Chicken, Artichoke and Bacon Pizza and it came out burnt at the bottom. Would have sent it back but because it took 20 just to get the pizza in the first place and we had somewhere more important to me just ate where we could. Not sure if would come back to here again.

Went on a Thursday night before a comedy show. Felt very welcome as soon as we walked in.  Had a great waitress who was very friendly and made excellent menu suggestions. My friend and I wanted something light; we ordered Drunken Cheesy bread to start. Delicious. (Ladies Night half prices were a bonus.) The frozen margaritas were also tasty. We shared a chicken parm pizza, which was one of the best pizzas I've ever had.  Between the service and the food, can't wait to go back.

Amazing Italian Food!!! I found The Strand on Yelp. Thank you fellow Yelpers! I'm relatively new to Phoenix and spoiled by the famous italian food in Little Italy, San Diego... I'll admit I've found some awesome Italian food in Phoenix!

The Strand has traditional, scrum-diddly-umptious Italian Food in Phoenix, Arizona... 1/2 OFF Happy Hour is the best... Bartenders are sweet, great drinks... The lobster mac n cheese is everything you could want. I love seafood pastas and this is probably one of the tastiest dishes at The Strand..

They also cater!!! I was enthralled as I am constantly searching for affordable, amazing, creative caterers... They will be at Search Control's event at the ASBA headquarters, if you're not there for the internet marketing event, you'll be there for The Strand's awesome italian food (:

Very cute spot in downtown Phoenix. The host could have been friendlier but our server Stephanie was wonderful. I ordered the chicken parmesan, it would good however I still think North Italia's is better. My friend had the penne a la vodka which was "freakin delicious!" Definitely stop here if you're in the area.

Why the Hell did you refuse to seat our party of three just now and say "Oh uh yeah um we're full!" when there were three open tables right plain as day right before our eyes?!? Who told you this was a good business practice?

So we got reservations on NYE and I had been wanting to check this place out for quite some time. I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked it! The decor in the restaurant is nice, makes you wanna just hang out and have some wine and good food. I started with the crispy calamari that was served with two great sauces. The calamari was super tender and crispy, perfectly executed! I ended up going with the Prosciutto and Egg pizza, that was decent. I prefer my pizza more crisp and the eggs over easy. This pizza could have been awesoe, but the crust wasn't nearly crispy enough and the eggs seemed more scrambled. With egg on my pizza, the best part is the runny yoke on the pie, which this lacked. I'll definitely come back and give it another shot. Chalk this up as another win for Cityscape!

It was just... aight.  

Came here before watching Dave Chappelle perform at Comerica Theatre.  There was also a Phoenix Suns game that same night.  I was surprised that we were seated so promptly given that other restaurants around were majorly busy.  There was a good amount of people there but service was prompt and our waitress wasn't too overbearing.  

Honestly, I don't remember what I ordered only because it was mediocre.  Whatever it was tasted bland... well, more like blahhhh... and for the amount of money we spent, definitely not worth it.

I think this spot has a lot of potential.  I mean, it's in a great location, in the middle of the hustle and bustle of downtown Phoenix but the menu and its items could use some improvement.  I think I'll just stick to Arrogant Butcher next time (right next door).

I have eaten there once and the food was excellent but i went there yesterday with 12 co-workers and there was big piece of plastic in my salad. I told the server there was plastic in my salad as i was holding it up and she replied "was it actually in your food" as i politely responded "no it was just in mouth from the bite i took from my food"...I will not be having any more meals there..
Excellent bolagnase, meatballs, and seafood spaghetti.  The angry shrimp appetizer was nicely spiced.  The service was also good.(James?)we enjoyed eating on the patio.

Don't bother. We were here for an event at Talking Stick Arena. We arrived at 6:00 pm and were seated right away, so we thought,"great!"  But we waited, and waited, and waited for 30 minutes. No one approached our table AT ALL!  Yet other tables were being served. Even people that arrived after we did. If I could give it 0 stars, I would.

I was here for a conference and had a night on our own for dinner. Two of my co-workers and I decided on this place. We were able to get a seat outside. It was such a beautiful night so we were very happy about that. Our server was there right away, took our drink orders and was back within minutes with our drinks. We ordered an appetizer for the table and our meals. The services was so great, loved the atmosphere and the food was very good. We told our other co-workers who didn't join us to try it. They did and loved it just as much!
Ordered the fettuccine and caprese. Very good food and kind service. Will be coming back again. One of the better Italian restaurants for sure in phoenix.

I saw this place because of the awesome decor inside, the chandeliers, color, and  furniture give the place a nice flair! Me and a friend went about 2 weeks ago, we arrived late about 9ish and decided to sit at the bar. The bartender was amazing, she was great, she went over the menu with us and even informed us it was reverse happy hour and suggested some of her own favorite dishes on the menu.

I decided to go with their hamburger with parmesan french fries, yum! Their food portions are well worth it, the hamburger was huge and I got a plate full of fries, also the cheese garlic bread as an appetizer was delicious, not to mention their ice tea was amazing (and I'm a big tea drinker). We stayed quite sometime and I witnessed some guests still coming in close to closing time and the staff still seated them and served them instead of turning them away, that's giving good customer service.

I plan to go back and with friends soon, The Strand rocks in my book! Thank you guys at The Strand for giving me and my tummy a good time! :)

The two stars are for the good service. NO stars for the food and drinks. Sub-par, to say the least. The sauce tasted canned, the bread was flavorless, the pasta was overdone, the pesto was just weird, and the cocktail tasted like a grocery store mix. Unsatisfying on every level, and an insult to the people who chose to eat there. I imagine it only survives by getting the overflow from the far superior restaurant next door.

Adam, the bartender (manager?) is a great restaurant employee. I wasn't the biggest fan of a small part of my salad. The eggplant was not very good. I ate the rest of my salad, (it was really good minus the eggplant).  Adam was concerned over my experience and offered solutions to make it better.  I left feeling good about my experience and will definitely go back.
Veronica was our server and was fabulous for our party of 10!  Separate checks, no problem.  Food was fantastic! Will return if I'm back in Phoenix!

My family and I wanted to try this place out prior to an event downtown and will not be coming back. The hostess sat us very quickly but that was the only quick thing about this place. The gentlemen next to us noted it took 20 minutes to ask for a drink. We had waited 30 minutes when two other tables were seated. Not once during this time were we greeted by our wait staff and noticed the other tables started placing orders. The waitress even served drinks to the table next to us and still didn't acknowledge us. There were several wait staff so it was not an issue of staff shortage. We left after waiting 30 minutes and like I said, will never come back nor recommend this place to anyone.
Got very sick when I got home. Short ribs & mash potatoes. I'd give it one more visit at another time, but first I need to get my stomach right.

We love this place!  Everything I've ever ordered has been delicious,  comes out hot and is well presented.   It always amazes me that the restaurant "next door" will have all the hip diners standing and waiting to get in, while we slip into The Strand, get served immediately sip an enjoyable glass of wine and while our  delightful meal is servef before the hipsters next door even get seated.  It's a gem of a place you should definitely try. Check out the angry shrimp!

Good food! Located in cityscape. We parked in the parking garage for cityscape then gave our parking ticket to our server and got it validated. Great location! I had the lobster Mac and cheese with bacon, so good! Fantastic service with a good environment. Good prices for the quality of food. Definitely will come back again and eat here before a basketball game.

I work at a location very close to The Strand. I called if they offer discounts to their neighbors (most restaurants downtown do..) and they don't, but I still ordered to go. The Bolognese is good... Maybe two small portions if you want to split it for two lunches. I asked if they could include bread, she said they would but when I opened my order up when I got to my desk, there was no bread. Should have confirmed when I picked it up but would have been nice if they did so without a reminder. It's the small things that matter to me... The taste of the Bolognese is okay, not anything super amazing but it was just shy of $11 for the entree. Also will ask for more sauce next time. So I'll try the take out again but will have to triple check my order at pick up.

Food looks better than it taste. Hmmm where do i start....

The "free bread" was untoasted,  cold and flavorless. It was served with okay flavored pesto. We wish the bread was warm and toasted like most places in Texas. 

Okay well we came in right before closing around 930pm and they close at 10pm. We were swated right away because no one else was in there. The waitress was very nice and sweet. We placed our drink orders and i had a house maragarita and my wife had a Chardonnay. She is an advid wine drinker and thought the Chardonnay was not good. She liked my Margarita but i did not. Too sweet and not enough Twang. 

On to the food. I had the Chicken Alla Vodka pasta.  Looked really good but subpar at best. Had to add tons of salt and black pepper to get some reminiscence of flavor. My wife had the chicken and broccli Alfredo pasta in which the pasta comes plain and you have to add Chicken and Broccoli  at an addtional cost. She too had to add salt and pepper to make it edible. As dar as freshness the chicken on both our dishes were skinny and looked like the chicken was frozen when added to our dishes. The chicken WAS firm and tasted like freezer. My wifes broccoli tasted like Hospital veggies or even the steamables that you buy from walmart. 

LONG STORY SHORT MY WIFE ENDED UP SICK AND NAUSEOUS FROM THIS PLACE. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. ONLY REASON FOR THE 2 STAR IS BECAUSE OF THE NICE WAITRESS. Nice atmosphere i guess

The food wasn't the most exquisite I've ever had, but everything else makes up for it. The ambience is great. It's chic and cute, but not to where I don't feel like I don't fit in. Drinks are super affordable ($8 for their version of a Long Island... Awesome). They played kickass music, which always helps. The only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars is my chicken Parmesan wasn't crispy. But even their bread sticks were amazing. Everything else was amazing. We will be back.

So I would like to first start this review off by saying that the food and the wait staff and even the manager who i had to speak to, not by my request, are very pleasant and worth coming back to. The only issue I had at this location was with the hostess who i had an unfortunate incident with. First they dont take reservations which is fine, i get it, second they have no way of letting people who check in for a table know that their table is ready which is not of this age. We arrive and are told that our wait is 25 min which again is fine. We literally step inside the restaurant next door and come back in 7 min to find that our name was called and our table was taken..which is weird because they made no effort to find us. I then asked the hostess, a young girl, how long are wait was going to be and she literally said "i dont know" . My next words to her were "as a hostess you should typically know how long the wait is". Fast forward to her telling me she didnt like my tone to her going to get her manager and then the manager asking me why his hostess was crying in the back about a disgruntled customer. 

i was not disgruntle and it is the hostess responsibility aka job to know this information. The manager i could tell agreed with me as he simply got us sat down in the next 5 min with no further issue and again the food, the waiter were great. 

if your going to have a hostess please make sure she is emotionally stable and can handle her job.

My office ended up choosing The Strand to have our post holiday luncheon here. I've been here before and never had an issue until now. There were 11 of us who were able to make the reservation we made in advance. When I made the reservation with specifics the host said they can accommodate our needs. We had two tables. At the table I was sitting at we had no issues. I told the waitress that we had previously asked if separate checks were fine and that we were doing that. She said ok no problem. I've had the lobster mac and cheese there which is delicious. I wanted to try something new this time. I opted for the pomodoro. When my food arrived it look delicious because it was plated so well. First bite no so good...it was very much flavorless! I had to add lots of salt. I had a few of the other women try it and they said it was very bland! We noticed our other table seem to be having problems but couldn't tell what was going on. After our lunch I asked one of the ladies how her lunch was. She said her meat came out burnt on the salad and the other women's lunch were not good either. Their chicken was cold and the noodles were over cooked. She then began to tell me that the waitress stared to bring out their bill without asking if they wanted anything else. They told the waitress they wanted to order dessert. That didn't sit well with the waitress as she began to cop an attitude with them. After that she brought the bills again and this time the bills were wrong. When they brought it to her attention she told them "separate checks are a privilege". She was really rude to them. When we were leaving I asked the waitress why she would say the comment about separate checks. She blew up at me as if it were my fault. I told her that the restaurant had no issues with doing separate checks as I had previously cleared that. She stared yelling at me then rudely threw her hands in my face and snubbed me! I asked for my bill back to remove her tip for what she had just done to me as I didn't appreciate it! She threw the bills down in front of me and told me to find it! I did and I removed my tip! She continued to yell and throw her hands in my face! While all of this was going on there was a man standing next to us working behind the bar. He was witnessing the entire incident go down. All he said was "that's enough". I'm not sure who he was saying that to. I walked out pissed! My coworker called the restaurant to speak with the manager. He got on the phone and introduced himself by the name Adam. Come to find out that was the man/ manager who was witnessing the incident and not stopping his employee from acting the way she did! Great managing skills Adam! To top it off he also said the "waitress" we we had who was rude and the one yelling at me was also a manager! I would put her name on here but she refused to give me her name. Adam continued to tell my coworker that she walked out and quit! Good! Someone like that who treats customers the way she did doesn't need to represent a restaurant in my opinion! Overall I give this restaurant a bad rating due to the horrible customer service and bland tasting food! Would never go back! Would never recommend to anyone! Much better places downtown to eat at!

So I should say that I was told that this place was like an Italian Pei Wei style type of restaurant, i.e. fast casual. But, two months ago they did decide to provide full dinner service which I really appreciated! Great location and loved the decor. 

We ordered the chicken parmesan pizza and the lobster mac and cheese. Pizza was underwhelming, and chicken was a bit dry. But the lobster mac and cheese was really good! Definitely rich and greasy though, so not the best for calorie conscious days. 

Overall, it's alright. I think I would rather come back for the happy hour menu than do the full dinner service.

Came for dinner and the staff was friendly. Food was mediocre at best. We had the chicken parm and the marinara sauce was watery.  Also had the chicken piccata which had no real flavor. The garlic mashed potatoes was the best thing on my plate.
Food and service were good, I work front desk at a local hotel. I will continue to recommend our guests here :)

Mediocre. 

Service: We came on Sunday during lunch time and they were very much understaffed. Our waiter was running back and forth and was visibly stressed. He never introduced himself or asked to take our drink order. We only had water with our lunch. He also barely checked on us. 

Food: BLAND. I ordered their lobster mac and cheese and was surprised we did not get bread with our order. The entree itself was nothing special a bit dry and desperately in need of flavor. My husband had the burger. Though he ordered it medium well, it was very dry. Even the sweet potato fries needed more seasoning!

Decorations: They had some pretty interesting light fixtures.

With the many wonderful places in downtown Phoenix, we will not be returning.

I have visited The Strand about 2 years ago when I lived in Phoenix. I liked it then, the food was good. Now visiting for vacation, I decided to bring my group along. I was disappointed walking through the door. The restaurant has not changed a bit. The decor is great. It's modern and confortable. I have no problem with that and I throughly enjoy it. The menu is exactly the same though, and I wanted to see something new and fresh. Deciding between rosemary salmon and pasta, I choose the pasta because in Seattle, we can get fresh salmon everywhere. I would love to see a fresh sheet, or just something different. We ordered the bruschetta as an appetizer and it was delish. Also fast. My pasta and my partners lobster mac came out quickly as well, which makes me worry about buyout ingredients. The food is good. However, the table next to us ordered butternut squash ravioli and we're saying it was cold. 

Drink wise, the wine list is okay. Nothing to rave about. I didn't see a ros and I was kind of craving that. Settled for a reisling. My partner ordered a sangria. Waters seemed very tap tasting and unfiltered.

My biggest complaint would be with the staff. Not necessarily the quality of service, but the complete lack of class. The female servers are all in extremely short and tight skirts and lots of cleavage. Not our cup of tea. For a moment I thought the Tilted Kilt upstairs would have more class. The guys on the kitchen, although they look like they know what they're doing, I would rather see chef coats on instead of tshirts and ballcaps. Our server Jessica was nice. I would personally pay a bit more if the staff cleaned up a bit and the ingredients seemed not as bought (aka my pasta, croutons).

Overall, I liked my food but the other detractors really killed my mood. Perhaps this is what the local clientele are into, but it's not for me. This place has a ton of potential. Edit: no yelp check-in bonus: sad face.

Nom, nom, nom!!!! So good! Never had a bad meal! Everything is amazeballs. My favorite is the steak and kale salad. Last week I tried one of the pastas cuz they always look so good when I see them go by. Again they surpassed my expectations. We ALWAYS get the calamari and it's THA BOMB! I love this place. I can't say enough good things. The service is always great, food is spectacular, and it's just easy and fun and accessible. Love it!

Love eating here!  They totally cater to your diet!  Served up a dish that wasn't on the menu, but dished it up for me anyway!!  Yum!  Adam, the manager, is the very best at providing quality service to his customers!  He cares about the quality of the food he serves!

ok, I have serious reservations about this place, food wise and service wise. Considering their location, they should be way, way better prepared for crowds. This was horrible service for a order, and sit down and be served kind of place.
None of the servers knew what was going on with their tables. My boyfriend canceled part of his order after wait 35 minutes for it. I would of loved to have canceled mine, since they couldn't nail the whole concept of put the cold meat balls in the microwave longer, even on the second try.
The table next to us was complaining up a storm for the same reason.
I kept waiting for my boyfriends' meal to come out, so we could eat together, it never came out. He ate part of my cold meal , and we left hungry, that is after he stood in line for 15 minutes to get his entree taken off the bill. I ordered the primavera, it sounded better than it tasted, the meatballs might of been good , but they were so cold they didn't have a great deal of taste. Would have to be desperate and see no crowd to ever go back there again.

Went here before a show at Stand Up live. The happy hour had blue moon's for $2!! The frozen margaritas are our favorite! I got the Chicken Parm which I think was better than Carrabba's. Wife got a burger for some reason but said she loved it a little better than Joe's Farm Grill. We had a great time with an attentive waiter. We can't wait to go back. 

PARKING TIP: Eating at a restaurant gives you a two hr validation while stand up live gives a three hr window. We only parked for less than 5hrs but they will only accept one block of hrs for free so we had to pay $5. The way to avoid it would be to pull out of garage and then right back in to get a new parking pass for the comedy show.

3.5 stars. Had the crab linguini which was the daily special it was just ok. Would have liked to been offered bread or salad. Plus no real cheese sprinkled on the pasta... The kid liked the meatball & strands. Next time i'll try the drunken bread, lobster Mac and fig bruschetta.

First time in Phoenix friend took us there. Very nice, some traditional Italian dishes. I had the Chicken Alfredo. My wife had Chicken Marsala. Our server was Adrianna and did a great job. Would go there again.

The Strand drew my attention when I first saw it and promised I would come back because it seemed interesting. The best part of the visit was the fact that our waiter was nice enough to stamp on my receipt to validate my parking because I lost my ticket from the parking garage below the restaurant (CityScape). He was very accommodating and unfortunately that's about how good the experience was here. 

The spaghetti with meatballs and balsamic vinegarette salad were horrible. The spaghetti tasted border-line elementary school cafeteria-ish, cheap and bland. Honestly, I felt like Oregano's spaghetti is better! Yes, I preferred a major chain over this. 

The salad was luke warm, wilted and soggy. It made me wonder if this was left under the heat lamp with the spaghetti. The cheese pizza was gobbled by my 3 year old, so I'm glad he enjoyed himself quite well.

The rating would be lower if it wasn't for the great attitude of the waiter, but the food alone will not get me back.

We went here last night after the Symphony and it was okay. They told us when we walked in that they were no longer serving dinner, only appetizers, salads, and pizza, which was fine with us: my wife wanted a salad and I wanted pizza. 

We sat on the patio and our waitress was right over to take our drink orders, and then back a few minutes later with our wine. My wife ordered the salmon salad, and I had the chicken pizza. The waitress came back a few minutes later to report that they were out of salmon, so she ordered the pear salad. 

Our food came, and although the pizza looked good, it was just okay. The big slice of chicken breast on the pizza made it hard to eat...maybe shredded chicken would be easier. The pizza was warm, but not hot enough to give you that little blister on the roof of your mouth. I didn't eat the last two slices because they were cold after I'd eaten the first four. My wife's salad was fine, although she remarked that there were a lot of greens and not as much "good stuff."

I don't know that I'd say to my wife, "Hey, let's drive downtown and mess around with parking and go to the Strand," but as a casual place within walking distance of Symphony Hall it was fine. We'd probably go back.

My Bestie and I were attending a concert recently (Steely Dan!), and, as we often do, we opted to stay at Hotel Palomar, which is within walking distance of the venue. I learned of The Strand while searching the worldwide interweb for dinner plans.

We arrived about 5:15 on a Tuesday, so it was not at all crowded. It did, however, mostly fill up while we were there.

The calamari was okay, but I would not place it in my Top 3. Not bad, just not shout-worthy. The Angry Shrimp was excellent and not too spicy in our opinions. The seafood linguine was delicious! Mussels and scallops and shrimp (oh, my!) were not over- or under-cooked, and the pasta was terrific. We opted for a bottle of Cabernet / Merlot / Syrah ('Super Tuscan') which was just right. Kudos to Ashley for outstanding service.

We're going to another concert in about a week, and I'm pretty sure I know where dinner will be....

WOW! This place is great! From the vibe to the dessert, I have NO complaints!
The drinks were amazing and the bartender was great. The Lobster Mac n Cheese and Chicken alla Vodka were incredible! I can't wait to go back!

Happy hour on a sat!! i'm a fan!! 

Cold beer, blue moons for  2 :)
half price appetizers calamari really good 
to finish off yummy chicken pizza
and validates parking!!
really nice place, really cute for a day night or a girls night out! 
clean and stylish and great service!

Terrible customer service. The hostess (red head) took down a list of people due to a busy night (something that normal restaurants do) as soon as she was overwhelmed with people coming up to the host stand complaining about wait times she abandoned the list and would seat the pushiest people of the group. I'm not one to write reviews about restaurants, but this was extremely irritating and we ended up walking away after trying to be the patient ones. Don't recommend to anyone.

Definitely a four star restaurant. Amazing decor greets you upon entrance. Don't miss the espresso and margarita drinks available frozen for $6.00. They are served with Boba large straws and have some fun floaty treats, yay! :) Yes, there's still a kid inside of me that loves to discover new flavors through a straw (or wait is that the old person inside of me?Ew.) 

The LUNCH was amazing! You have your sandwiches; meatball and chicken parm, and served w/ choice of fries or salad. We had the best of both worlds and it was almost too much for two to share, but still, very good flavors and fresh ingredients. 

We really enjoyed our time. A Stella that was served in the appropriate glass finished off our Satuday Funday, as the frozen drinks for $6 were very good. Not to sound cheap, because their wine menu was great, and they have a full bar, seemingly a perfect place for drinks with friends or more fancy times-- but this was lunch. 

I will be back, maybe just for the really great decor and frozen drinks, but the food shouldn't be missed either. Nice spot to know about in Phoenix.

Oh the strand! I honestly have mixed feelings about this place but I keep coming back. The pastas are not heavy, some of them are not that great and just seem to be put together quickly without thought. The mussels and clam appetizer is amazing and is honestly the reason why I keep coming back. The waitress will only give you free bread if you ask for it. They have some good items it's just hit and miss. The service is Ok. Never really had a problem except for the bread part.

We recently hosted our daughter's baptismal reception at The Strand; the food, service and ambience were more than we could've asked for. The staff had displayed our minimal decor and even arranged for a separate dessert/gift table without us even asking for it. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive. Most importantly, the food and drinks were great! The menu was served family style as we were 75 people. We had margherita pizzas, calamari, bruschetta, balsamic and caprese salads, bolognese, alfredo with chicken, smoked gouda and vegetable ravioli and chicken picatta. Considering the majority of our guests are Sicilian, they can be tough food critics when it comes to eating Italian food but everyone was very complimentary! The owner, Adam, even made the scheduling and planning process very easy. Thanks again Adam to you and your staff for a wonderful evening!

By far one of the poorest restaurants in the area. They told me that since I am twenty five years of age and have valid out of state drivers license that I am unable to purchase liquor because it is not horizontal. They said this was Arizona state law, which it is not. If you are going to refuse service at least know your laws. The food is poorly composed and is in massive portions. Would never return to this establishment.

Popped in for a quick meal before a show. Fun decor, brand new and sparkling clean, with a nice sized menu. We chose this restaurant because it advertised gluten free pasta. Unfortunately, no one on staff seemed to know what "gluten free" meant. When we asked which sauces might be GF to go with the GF pasta, we were met with blank stares. It took several questions to determine that the marinara sauce "might" be GF -not very confidence inspiring. When we did get our meals, everything tasted fine, not fabulous, about on par with a Pei Wei type experience. I had a small side house salad, which was not on the menu, but was offered by the girl at the register.  The greens were nice, but not chilled, which was kind of yucky.  The balsamic vineagrette was not able to be GF certified, so I had it on the side.  It was just OK.  My GF pasta was cooked properly, and the portion was large but not too large.  I had the primavera with marinara sauce, and while the veggies seemed fresh, they were a tad overcooked.  My husband had a pizza, seemed to be pretty good.  My daughter had a kids meal of chicken tenders and fries--the tenders were a chicken breast cut into slices, which worked, and the fries were a tad bit reminiscent of Burger King's, with some parmesan thrown on top.  The kid's meal also came with mini donuts, which we had to ask for 3 times, but there were fresh out of the fryer and covered in cinammon sugar--yummy.  We ordered ice cream with a GF chocolate chip cookie--and what arrived was definitely not a "cookie"--more like a gluey, gooey chocolate chip amoeba at the bottom of a dish with 2 scoops of ice cream on top.  Eh.

I tried to order an espresso machiato at the coffee bar in back of the restauant--the coffee girl didn't know the correct way to make the drink, so I opted for a soy cappucino--this was tasty and well done.


This is clearly a new business still working out the kinks. I think it's a good option if you're in downtown PHX and need a quick, decent meal.

I am in Phoenix on business and thought I would stop into The Stand for "Linner" (lunch and dinner ;-p ) . The atmosphere is clean and modern , has nice booth seating and was comfortable. It has a lot of ambiance potential :)  I came in around 4p so maybe down time for them??  However it is downtown near a lot of hotels and such so I'm sure they are used to it. I mean HH!?!? 
Ok so this is probably something that bothers me more than most BUT I am all about atmosphere and ambiance....A nice Italian restraunt and COUNTRY music on the radio, LOL! Like super countryfied Country!!  Really killed the vibe and made me question how serious they are about their establishment..... I know, I know, sounds EXTREMLY nit- picking of me AND I am from Texas! I love country music but I made me feel like I was invading their down time and that managers jam or whatever ! ALSO the menu is exclusively  Italian so??!?? 
  Ok so past the music thingy. The  waiter brought bread and some sort of pesto sauce for dipping. It was very vinegary, I didn't care for it, olive oil is preferable to me,  but bread was good.  
Under my waiters suggestion I tried the Chicken Piccata. It was pretty flavorable and nice size portion...very "rich" I would say, but chicken looked kinda slimy under piccata sauce. I ate half then lost my appetite. 
My server was nice, probably the manager because he had regular clothes on. 
Overall I would probably give it another try, maybe at night time when they are hopefully more prepared for guests and try something else on the menue.

Another trendy spot with not so hot food.  We had the Lobster Mac and Cheese and the Pancetta Pasta with sweet peas both were really bland.  The rice ball appetizer with two dipping sauces was delightful however.  

This may be better spot for drinks and appetizers.

My boyfriend and I both work in restaurants, and we always try not to be too picky and judgmental when we go out. That being said, I feel like we haven't had the best experiences eating out since moving to Phoenix two years ago. After a friend came here for his anniversary and raved about it, we decided to give it a try. We cook a lot of Italian food at home and weren't sure what to expect. Holy cow were we blown away. We were greeted immediately at the door by the hostess who sat us at a clean spacious table on the patio. The waitress came over promptly with waters and took our drink order. The owner, Ross, came over and turned on a heater for us just as it was getting a little chilly. Our drinks and appetizers arrived quickly and our entrees came out shortly after. I got the Alfredo and added meatballs (maybe a little weird, I don't care!) while my boyfriend got the chicken alla vodka. Our food was phenomenal and the portions were generous. We so look forward to coming back here and I will be recommending The Strand to everyone.

Small and tight seating arrangements. I ordered the primodoro and found it to be of good portion size. I found the taste delicious. I did not like the atmosphere or the size of the establishment, that is why i provided a 3 star rating. I think the menu choices were decent. My meal was good.
Good food, service a little slow.  Vodka pasta was good and the salmon was tasty.  Angry shrimp also tasty, although they should use larger shrimp.  Location is perfect next to the stadiums.
This place had some good Meatballs. Nice little place in the downtown cityscape. My belly is so happy with it's life

We love this place! A great spot for lunch or dinner downtown. The food is always delicious, the complimentary bread and pesto in the beginning is a nice touch, and we've never been disappointed here. Highly recommend!

This was our second visit and we were just as pleased as the first time. We were seated immediately and our waitress was ready for us. 

We started with the clams & mussels and they are so good I could drink the broth! I decided to have the wedge salad and it was a perfect portion. My husband had the baked Mac and cheese and he thought it was delicious. 

There were plenty of seats when we arrived but it was filling up as we were leaving, around 8:30pm. 

We will be back for sure!
I'm visiting Phoenix and just stumbled into this restaurant. Friendly staff, awesome food, reasonably priced!!!!

Ate here last night with 3 friends and let's just say the experience was not the best. Either the calamari was not prepared right, or my stomach all of a sudden does not like seafood. The calamari gave me a horrible stomach bug. The crab linguine was room temperature and not hot but if it had more heat it would have been amazing. The waiter did not smile and all most seemed it was a issue serving us. Maybe he was having a bad day. Last thing that irritated my friends was that 4 girls were staring at us while we were waiting for our food. We looked over the smiled and then turned away. Keep in mind these are employees. Overall decent food would not go back again.

Had a wonderful dinner on a Thursday evening. My wife had the pasta with meatballs. My daughter had the Lobster Mac-N-Cheese. She enjoyed it very much.

I had the Seafood Linguine. The pasta was made with squid ink. It was black and was incredible. You need to go and try this dish. That is the dish I will have next time we go. Don't let the idea of squid ink throw you. I does not taste like you were sucking on the end of a pen. It adds a subtle sweetness to the dish. Try it and let me know what you think.

Great place for pasta downtown.

Felicia, Felicia, Felicia...

The best service I've had in Phoenix to date. I told Felicia what I normally drink, she shook her head approvingly and walked to the bar, came back with several originals for me to partake of. 

They stayed open late for us! Im sure she had better things to do. ..


Sidenote:

When I walked in I saw 4 skateboarders at the bar. 
Apparently, they work there, so, yeah, I'll be back.
Love the pear salad. Pizzas are good too. I have always had good service. No complaints!

Waitress was unable to tell us about happy hour specials.  We had to ask her to ask someone.   Ordered the Clams & Mussel appetizer and there was hardly any meat. Upon receiving check, our appetizer was not discounted for happy hour.   We were told it was because we ordered off the lunch menu. So, be careful about the happy hour pricing.  
They have a creamy pesto sauce for the bread which is  phenomenal!
I ordered the qenua dish and there wasn't any seasoning so it was blah.  The Chicken Marsala dish was wonderful.
There was some funky, artsy,  tube-like,  coiled lighting above each table.   Ours had bugs trapped in it....we didn't look up to see until we were leaving, otherwise we would have asked for another table.

It started a bit rough, however, John (not sure if he is the manager?) made this experience worth it! 

For being downtown near major venues, especially during the holiday season, we expected it to be busy. But we did not expect the service to literally forget & neglect us. We opted to sit on the patio, it being less crowded. However- once we were sat, we sat for 30+ minutes without anything but menus. No water. Multiple servers were attending tables around us... we got up to walk out. 

John happened to stop us, and was MORE than helpful/attentive. Had it not been for him, we would have left. Just needing a brief but decent meal before our show, we were able to have some delicious small plates- the food is GREAT! Butternut squash ravioli was the best I have ever had. 


But still, throughout the entire experience- John was the only reason this place gets the stars it does, along with the food. Not at ALL impressed with how rude the rest of the wait staff was, literally ignoring us, visually noticing us sitting there making eye contact attempting to get at least a glass of water! None of the 3 ladies standing at the hostess station did much besides point to the patio & say, "sorry we are busy someone will eventually be with you". The staff, besides John, needs some serious instruction on customer service. 

But thank you to the kitchen for some excellent dishes, and most thanks to John! Really appreciate his effort in turning the experience around & genuinely caring for his customers. We all understand how hectic weekend evenings can be, especially during the holiday season, but this was one of the first times I have actually gotten up to walk out from a place- so we want to make sure John receives highest compliments because the food was great & HE made the difference between a total flop. 

I'd really like to return & try more of the menu- the food is absolutely great with a decent variety, plenty to choose from as well as reasonably priced. I just can't say I am eager to immediately return after the major lack of customer service. Please take some notes from John- total pro & saved the evening/review!
Came in for lunch-  we had a great experience.  Tasha was very friendly  and welcoming.  A fun place to dine or just having a couple  of cocktails. My favorite new place!
Service is slow!  Food is decent. I had the caramelized pear salad with grilled shrimp, it was decent.
Amazing happy hour...1/2 price appetizers and great drink specials.  The $5 martinis were great and well mixed - definitely check this place out!

We accidentally ended up at The Strand when our first choice down the street had an hour wait for a table for two. What a glorious find! Fast & friendly service, delicious food. We had the angry shrimp, which was shrimp cooked perfectly in a spicy Italian marinara sauce, served with warm, lightly toasted bread. The spaghetti and meatballs were delicious as well. Highly recommended.

This was my first time coming to The Strand. It was a Saturday night. Dead. Service was ok although the waitress couldn't tell me the dessert menu offhand (out of only four items). Most were store bought, not freshly made. I had the seafood linguine. Not good at all. The pasta clearly tasted old and my first bite of clam contained a gritty hunk of sand. The sauce was disappointing. Not flavorful. It was spicy and that's about it. For $18 I expected much better quality. The kicker came at the end when I was asked about the meal. I told the woman it was just ok and listed all the reasons why. She said she would send the manager. He came over and didn't want to hear what was wrong with the dinner which was really surprising. I heard the staff will be completely changed, but I won't be coming back. The Strand is strung out!
Meh. Ordered the pizza. It wasn't as good as I would have hoped for the price. Drinks were acceptable but overpriced.

Very cute concept...but unfortunately that is the only good thing I can say.  4 of us went for dinner prior to a Suns game and they could not handle the crowd.  This is a fast casual Italian concept - order at the counter, find a table and they bring the food to you - should be in and out.  We waited 20 or so minutes in line and then grabbed a table.  Another 30 minutes passed before the first entree was delivered.  Another 20 minutes later two more entrees arrived and 5 minutes later we received the final entree.  Unfortunately the food was mediocre at best.  We had a 12" pepperoni pizza, two orders of ravioli with creamy tomato sauce (the ravioli on one order had hard edges) and the chicken saltimbocca.   It was edible, it was fine, but it's not worth further description.  

There were many, very unhappy customers and very little effort by management to assuage anyone.  While on the subject of management, you would think that in crisis mode you would see all hands on deck in hustle mode, however that was not at all the case.  There was a manager and another employee just standing at the counter and looking around toward the end of the rush while a few customers were waiting for food and tables.  The table next to us vacated and it was 20 minutes before it was bussed.  Bizarre.

We overheard a manager (I think)  talking to some other customers and explaining that this is the third time they've experienced this kind of service break down at dinner due to the crowd.  Really?  You are a hop and a skip from US Airways Arena.  I'm pretty sure your business model was banking on that when the location was chosen.  However after two previous dinner service failures it didn't occur to you to check the downtown calendar, staff up and fix any other issues on the line?

I really wanted to like this place.  Big time fail.

This wasn't my first time going to strand. With good experiences in the past it seemed to make sense to go back on a Friday. The hostess was polite and seated us promptly. The server stopped by shortly later to take or drink orders(and we put in for the drunken cheesy bead appetizer due to happy hour ending shortly.) The drunken cheesy bread was meh, but our entrees were very good. I had the chicken something or another that the server recommended and it was the best dish of the bunch. I would recommend strand to anyone. The drinks were very tasty and strong without tasting strong. The atmosphere is nice as well.

In had the meatballs and strands (spaghetti). This place is awesome. The sauce is a little spicy, but I really really like it like that. I thought it made the sauce excellent. Meatball was amazing! It could have been that it was cooking in sauce all day because I came at 9 PM so it was tender, whatever it was by far it was the best meatball I have had in years. Staff was supper friendly and nice. Even as it approached closing time there was never an inkling of rush, very attentive. Highly recommended if you are downtown -- it's worth it.

Very hip place right across from the diamondback stadium in downtown Phoenix. The place was packed on a Saturday night with a 45 min wait so i recommend you make reservations. My group of 6 was perfectly happy to sit at the bar. The bartender greeted us right away and asked if we wanted to sample anything after helping us narrow our selections of wine. Immediately after getting our drinks a very friendly server got our orders. We ordered appetizers but unfortunately everything came out at the same time (you may want to specify that apps come out first!). I ordered prosciutto, risotto and ricotta fried puffs that were delicious with the 2 dipping sauces as an appetizer which i shared with my friend. I also shared the veggie pizza, which was nothing to write home about. The toppings all slid off the pizza and the crust was bland. All in all i would give the atmosphere and the bartenders 4 stars but the service and the food maybe a 2. So ho to The Strand and order some drinks and an appetizer then head over to another restaurant nearby for the main course.

My colleague and I decided to have dinner here as it had a varied menu and was right around the corner from our hotel. We had the bruschetta, balsamic salads, beef tortellini and lobster mac and cheese.

The bruschetta was flavorful and the right size for an appetizer and the salads were well balanced albeit a bit heavy on the dressing. The beef tortellini was perfectly cooked and the sage cream sauce was rich. The kitchen was also quite accommodating when we asked to add in some additional veggies to the tortellini. The.lobster mac and cheese was very cheesy and cream and there was a generous helping of lobster and bacon which was pleasantly surprising. The entree sizes were large and we had a hard time finishing them, though we wanted to eat it all.

The bar, on the other hand, left a bad taste on our mouth, literally. To start off the meal, my colleague ordered a sparkling water offered on the menu. The bottle she got was flat so she asked for the correct one. The waitress/hostess went to consult the bartender and came back with a new bottle of the same stuff claiming that was the sparkling water. We should have just given up then. However, we ventured to order a glass of pinot noir and a strawberry tessarosa martini. The wine was awful! It smelled and tasted sour as if it had been left sitting out too long without a cork and turned bad. And the martini tasted like watered down cranberry juice at the top and then became straight vodka at the bottom. There was also long muddled strawberries or basil in the drink as the description promised. Luckily our waitress/hostess was nice enough to take the glass of wine off the tab but I don't know how the bartender got the job.

Three star review because the food was delicious but the bar and service left something to be desired. They were understaffed that night though so I'll let them slide and the hostess coffee her best job.

My husband and I ate here tonight to try something new. We were not impressed. I was hoping the zucchini appetizer would have been made fresh, but it seems it comes pre-made. I got the fettuccine alfredo with chicken, it wasn't great but ok. My husband got spaghetti and meatballs. About an hour after we ate, he got an upset stomach. :-(

My girlfriend and I waited 45 minutes for our food to come out after ordering. People who came in 20+ minutes after us were receiving their food before ours ever came out. No apology or compensation was given for the food arriving so late. The angry shrimp appetizer was delicious but our main dishes, pasta and pizza, were mediocre at best. Will not come back.

Great friendly place in downtown Phoenix food and drink is reasonable and nice atmosphere! 
Staff was friendly service was very good 
The food was not 4star but very good and better than average!
I would go back for sure 

Enjoy,

Great service, good atmosphere, decent food. The chicken parm was soggy, Alfredo not very creamy, but the flavors were good. It was not a "wow" and not be my first choice to go in the future, but I would eat a meal here again.

I found this place on the Urban Spoon a whole ago and this is the second time I visited here. I'm glad I found this nice little place.
