Meals were ok , nothing great. Server never came by to fill our water, and took a looooong time to help us with any requests. I would not make an effort to eat there.

Stopped in here for during a "Taste tours" tour of downtown PHX.  The bruchetta was fine but the bread could have been toasted, it was too soft and the mix soaked in too much.  The pasta was fine, but not spectacular.

We ordered the "italian margarita" but I'm not sure why it was considered "italian".  It tasted like a regular margarita but extremely frozen.  We had the worst brain freezes of our life.  My whole group of friends, all five of us, found it painful to finish our drinks.

The atmosphere was pretty, not a bad place to grab a quick drink, but I wouldn't make the trek out to phoenix for this restaurant.

We came here for dinner before a Suns Game. We were sat in an awkward corner of the restaurant where we felt we were forgotten about. The food was slightly bland, except the Parmesan zucchini appetizer, which was good. Service was mediocre at best. Took a bit to get our water and drinks. We weren't offered the complimentary bread. It took 15 minutes for our server to print our check, pick up our credit card and return our receipt. Most likely will not return.

Great concept...notwithstanding the quirkiness in delivery.

Food was outstanding...but I have a hard time forgetting that it took nearly one hour to have one dish of pasta delivered to our table. I understand that they were busy and I respect that....However my dish was brought to the table barely warm and I had to send it back to get reheated twice.

Yes I like my food hot...While we were not in a rush as we arrived plenty of time early for the Cirque du Soleil show...One server was outstanding while the others seemed completely indifferent and in over their heads.

Caesar salad was great...but then again that's one in my book that's hard to mess up.

Pasta with meat sauce was very tasty even though it was sent back to the kitchen twice.

The lines can be quite long. I do truly believe that The Strand has formidable potential and is a fantastic concept. The only problems I see is the lack of staff, and cooking Italian in a snap is a difficult task as the menu is quite diverse....Add to that long lines of customers out the door and a recipe for chaos can quickly simmer up...

The Strand is located in CityScape and entered into an agreement with its residents offering a discount if they dine there.  As residents, we believed they would honor this agreement but after numerous visits where its managers rejected the discount existed or worse, claimed the discount was discontinued, we've concluded both its management and its ownership has deliberately lied to us. Thus, this is a dishonest establishment unworthy of any positive reviews based on meritorious service or professionalism.

I rarely post a review, good or bad and the food is the only reason I'm posting one now.  This place looks great inside, but there's a reason The Arrogant Butcher next-door was packed and this place was mostly empty.  We were in a hurry so had to choose this place. We ordered a simple salad w/ chicken and a sausage and mushroom pizza, they also brought us bread w/ pesto.  The pizza was ok, thanks to cheese and sausage, but bland sauce and crust. The chicken in the salad reminded me of McDonald's, the tomatoes looked old and warm.  The pesto was ok also, just too lemon-y for me.  We will not be back.

The lobster Mac & cheese is one of the best I have ever had including from The Capital Grille which says a lot about this little place. Desert was to die for and I couldn't have spent my bday at a more delicious place can't wait to come back for more!

Nice menu, decent service, and ambience semi-intimate.  the Bolognaise was good. The garlic bread app was tasty but wish they'd give you a choice of no cheese. The Gouda vegetable ravioli was a good portion and tasted wonderful -  but not hot and sent it back to the kitchen for reheating. Did get house bread but pesto came from the fridge as it was ice cold. No dessert as the place is a little pricey but expected for downtown. Just wish these so called "trendy" places had quality of food instead of relying on alcohol sales. We received a 10% military discount which was appreciated. Overall, it was ok but I wouldn't run back.

I heard some good stuff about this place. When you first walk in, it was good ambience. Food was average. My boboyfriend ordered chicken alla vodka and I ordered the Margarita pizza. However, service was horrible. The waitress would walk off as you are talking to her. The first was when I got up to ask for ranch dressing I walked up to her. As I was talking she walked away. The second time was when I asked for a box. But overall,  good food.

The food is good the environment is hip but my waitress was HORRIBLE! She stuck a unwrapped straw in my drink and it splashed on me.. no apology and reached over me 5times had a stank face and honestly sucked

The strand was good, just not great. We ordered a chicken bacon pizza, chicken Parmesan, and beef tortellini. My son said the pizza was great, but then again I don't think I've ever heard a kid say any pizza was bad. The chicken Parmesan was overlooked and dry. The tortellini was amazing. Pasta cooked Al dente and the sauce was delicious. We also tried the calamari and it was good too.

Horrible experience!!!
-waited 15 mins for a waitress
-Sangria taste like water
-Alfredo taste like hamburger helper
On top of that the manager wanted to do nothing to make our first experience better!
We will never back!!!!

We arrived at 5:00 PM without a reservation and had immediate seating. By 5:30 the restaurant was packed. Great food and great service. The Pinot Noir was fabulous. We had the wedge salad, the pasta bollinese, and the salmon.  All were great.  Cost was $134 for three of us including $49 for wine and desert. Find it under the Twisted Kilt in Phoenix Cityscape.

On New Year's Day my niece and I came after our ice skating date.
I've passed by this place a few times and we where happy they where open on this holiday.
My niece had their cheese pizza and I had their meatball strand! She gave this place a good two thumbs up.
On my end, I liked the meatballs very much. Unfortunately, the spaghetti was over cooked and the bread and pesto they bring out was cold and the pesto a little runny.
All in all, not bad and we left with our bellys full!

Unbelievable. I come downtown to enjoy a concert and beforehand, end up in this place. I sit down expecting the least. All I wanted was a good night with my daughter, then I ordered the lasagna. A good night just got GREAT!  Blown away at how delicious it was. My daughter, picky eater, loved the alfredo thing. The staff is super friendly. And then Hank tried to walk in, they stopped him at the door.  He stood on the sidewalk yelling and we all ignored him. I will be back. I recommend The Strand. I still do not recommend Hank.

This place is on point. Food is fresh, healthy, and fantastic. Usually Italian leaves you feeling lethargic and full. Not here. I love it. Pear salad and the "Spring Bounty" Primavera are my top two recommendations.

Let me start by saying this place isn't BAD.....it's just not awesome. I went here on Friday night with the BF for a date and to use a Doozy Deal coup. We made reservations on opentable, which got us the table, but oddly, instead of confirming that we went to the restaurant, they cancelled our reservation. This was kind of annoying because we didn't get our points, but it could have been an honest mistake. We tried a variety of food including: arancini, drunken cheesy bread, strands w meatballs, and minestrone soup. We also got drinks- I got the Italian margarita and the BF got some white wine. His wine came out with cork or dust in it at first, but they replaced it when he told them. The marg was good, like an alcoholic slushee. The food was all pretty good...the minestrone had lots of veggies, but was on the salty side. The bread was a bit odd...did taste like wine, but I probably wouldn't order it again. The arancini were really good! They had some pancetta in it and came with a really tasty lemony sauce and a marinara. I only wish there were more of them! The 'strands' were good and the meatballs were juicy. The service was friendly but slow. Also, they brought all of our food out at the same time, which I didn't love because it made everything get cold before we got a chance to eat it...don't know why they wouldn't bring soup, then apps, then mains.....Overall, it was good...it just wasn't great....and I thought it was a bit overpriced. I would consider going back and giving them another try, especially for a happy hour or something.

I almost feel bad giving this a 2-star review because the food was pretty good. The reason I give it 2 stars is because we had terrible service. Our server was extremely slow, had no idea about what beer and wine they served, and didn't even know which of the wines that were ordered were red or white. She kept asking us "what color is that one?" Which I found pretty ridiculous.

The food was good though. I would suggest the pizzas as a group of us split a bunch of the different pizzas and every one of them was really good. I would say give it a try and hopefully you'll have better service than we did.

First time, had an excellent meal with excellent service! Friends had the chicken marsala and rosemary salmon, we had chicken piccata and Bolognese. For appetizers we had calamari and bruschetta, and great desserts. The staff was on top of it in spite of a really busy night and full house.

Last Weekend we had a group of 12 people for dinner for my Birthday. It was SO good!! Appetizers, dinners and drinks were great! Our whole party couldn't stop taking about the food and how they wanted to go back. Service was good as well and the restaurant is a nice modern sheik decor that was a nice ambience.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Came here for NYE dinner and I was relieved there wasn't a prixe fix menu like every other restaurant in downtown Phoenix. This was my first time here and I was pretty impressed with the size and decor. For some reason I was expecting something more casual but it was very nicely decorated and upscale. 

Our server was very attentive and friendly even with the place being packed. I ordered a martini and a margherita pizza. My drink was good but I was very disappointed in the pizza. The crust and dough were very limp and cheese too thick. When I took a bite, almost all of the cheese on the slice tried to come with it because it was so thick. I had some of my husband's pizza which was only slightly better. The dough was just too limp and not what I would expect from this place. Maybe Little Caesers. 

I want to go back though and give it another shot....

First time and left without trying anything because the service was that bad. My bf and I came in and sat at the bar close to 8 PM, given menus and water and that was that for the next 30 min. We were literally sitting at the entrance where the waiters/waitresses pass to enter the bar and NOTHING. We finally just got up and one of waitresses started approaching us and I told her not to bother because this was the worst service. The place wasn't even that busy, a few tables and the bar were empty,  the patio was dead.

I've only been here for lunch but both times were great! Jeremiah is awesome. Attentive, funny, patient and makes terrific recommendations! My first time I had the marguerite pizza and wedge salad. The salad was creative and fresh. Pizza was too thin and kind of soggy for my taste, but still tasted good, especially if you like thin pizza. The other day for lunch I tried the grilled chicken sandwich. . The menu is typical but there are a few creative things that stand out. I've never had to wait and the waiters are very attentive and friendly. The interior is surprisingly roomy, casual, comfortable, very clean. Good place for a business lunch or casual dinner. I plan to go back a few more times. They are now serving brunch too!

This is your basic, not high quality, fake Italian restaurant. 
The chicken was unseasoned, the calamari wasn't crispy, and they gave us a plain pepperoni pizza rather than the one we paid for filled with toppings. The parmesan fries were basic McDonald's fries sprinkled with cheese. We should've known what to expect when it was empty on a Friday night. Would not come back.

Living downtown I always like to check out new places. Being down the street from ASU downtown campus, it was quite convenient for me to stop in and check it out. Looked a little quiet on the patio, but there were a few people inside. Within a minute of setting foot in the restaurant I was greeted by a lovely employee who broke down the menu for me, especially since a majority of it is in Italian. This is a big plus in my book, considering employees give a great impression and feel for places, a greeter makes or breaks my interest in any new food place I try. 

After figuring what I was going to get, the chicken Marsala with a side of spicy tomato pasta, I ordered at one of the cashiering terminals. I was told this concept of "fast casual" can be compared to a peiwei or chipotle. The layout it not that specific or guiding, but I didn't mind--the service was prompt. 

The decor is very intriguing and I enjoy how the space is utilized. They also have a coffee bar, with hopes of breakfast in the near future, but it is a little hard to see. My food came out fairly quickly and it was hot and ready! The Marsala sauce was a bit runny, but the taste was exquisite! My chicken was slightly breaded and it was cooked great. My pasta was spicy! Those cooks do not mess around, what you ask for you get! 

I had to get up and order dessert, at least that was suggested because their dessert comes out within minutes. That was a bit of an inconvenience. Anyway, the pizza cookie or pizcotti that I had was the sugar cookie and it was really good. I like my dessert, so the serving size of this dessert was nothing compared to maybe an oregano's pizza cookie. I think if I had to share it I would be a bit upset.

I had a chance to talk a bit to a few employees, due to the down time in the restaurant. Sounds like this little place has plans for a big future. Including breakfast, "fast casual" lunch to move through the cityscape businesses, and a full service dinner that is going to be a bit more upscale. I am excited to see the evolution of this place into something even better! Can't wait to go back!

Tried the strand for the first time, atmosphere was clean and had good music but we were sat in an awfully closed in corner. Waitress was a little awkward as though she didn't quite know the menu but was nice and friendly. I ordered the lobster Mac and cheese. I'd give it three stars as well as it was more of a lasagna that was baked in the oven. Portion wasn't big or generous and there wasn't much lobster but it was $16. Wasn't that impressed with the food or staff and most likely will go to another Italian eatery next time.

Solid.

I was looking for something new to do for lunch, and my boss suggested The Strand. having not been fully committed to this place (I'd been here previously and was not impressed), I decided to give it a second chance. And I'm glad I did. Their chicken Parmesan is hugely proportioned with a generous amount of garlic/parm fries. Wasn't even able to finish it. I'm so looking forward to getting a second meal out of this.

This was ok. My kids completely enjoyed their meals. Our server, I think her name was Rachel, was friendly and seemed to know what she was doing. 
I can't put my finger on why this place didn't 'wow' me. Perhaps it's just another tourist spot downtown... Kind of generic. 
App portion of the muscles & clams seemed tiny for more than 1 person.

Went here in Sept '13 and had a great time. I had the lobster Mac n cheese which was great. Good selection of beers and wine. The server was probably the best part! I think her name was Kristen but she was from IL as well and gave us a ton of cool places to try out and bars to go to. She pretty much made our night, I just wish we went there earlier in our trip.

Went for dinner before a Diamindbacks games. It opened at 4 pm Saturday and we were the second party tgere. It started to fill up quickly. Each of us had pasta dishes, baked boulanese with cyeese, spaghetti and meatballs and chicken and pasta. Each was very good. Ate pretty quickly for the fame. Service was excellent, very attentive. Nice downtown dining.

A group of us were in town for a convention and did not want to wait to eat till late after it ended so we ordered this to be delivered while we got ready. 

Service- the order and deliver process was very smooth and easy. Only took about 30/45 minutes before the guy delivered our food. He came up to our hotel room as well so that was nice. 

Food:

Chicken ala vodka- my mom and I shared this and neither of us were impressed. Very bland in flavor. And extremely small portion for the price. I mean for almost $20 an meal it should be a lot tastier and much bigger portion. 

Shrimp Alfredo( I believe this is what it was) - our friend ordered this and again she said it was very bland and needed way more flavor. And also extremely small portion. 

Lobster Mac- our other friend got this and had a stomach ache the rest of the night. She actually left the convention early and stayed in her room the rest of the evening because she felt so sick. Which was a bummer because it was our last night all together. 

I don't want to give it one star because that doesn't seem entirely fair but none of us were impressed. Seemed like a huge rip off. We paid $80 for 4 meals and none of them were the size they should've been. They didn't even cover the bottom of the to go container. Don't think any of us would choose this on our future visits to Phoenix.
